sgraph

Class GL3ScenegraphRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sgraph.GL3ScenegraphRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IScenegraphRenderer

    public class GL3ScenegraphRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements IScenegraphRenderer
    This is a scene graph renderer implementation that works specifically with the JOGL library It mandates OpenGL 3 and above.
    Author:
    Amit Shesh

      • setContext

        public void setContext(java.lang.Object obj)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Specifically checks if the passed rendering context is the correct JOGL-specific rendering context GLAutoDrawable
        Specified by:
        setContext in interface IScenegraphRenderer
        Parameters:
        obj - the rendering context (should be GLAutoDrawable)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given rendering context is not GLAutoDrawable

      • addMesh

        public void addMesh(java.lang.String name,
           PolygonMesh mesh)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a mesh to be drawn later. The rendering context should be set before calling this function, as this function needs it This function creates a new GL3MeshRenderer object for this mesh
        Specified by:
        addMesh in interface IScenegraphRenderer
        Parameters:
        name - the name by which this mesh is referred to by the scene graph
        mesh - the PolygonMesh object that represents this mesh
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • drawMesh

        public void drawMesh(java.lang.String name,
            Material material,
            org.joml.Matrix4f transformation)
        Draws a specific mesh. If the mesh has been added to this renderer, it delegates to its correspond mesh renderer This function first passes the material to the shader. Currently it uses the shader variable "vColor" and passes it the ambient part of the material. When lighting is enabled, this method must be overriden to set the ambient, diffuse, specular, shininess etc. values to the shader
        Specified by:
        drawMesh in interface IScenegraphRenderer
        Parameters:
        name -
        material -
        transformation -

      • initShaderProgram

        Parameters:

      • getShaderLocation

        public int getShaderLocation(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: IScenegraphRenderer
        Get the location of a particular shader variable. Renderers for individual meshes will need this to provide mesh-specific properties like material to the shaders. The intention is that the renderer stores only what is required to render it, not necessarily the entire mesh itself.
        Specified by:
        getShaderLocation in interface IScenegraphRenderer
        Returns:
        an integer handle for the appropriate variable if it exists, -1 otherwise
